results.title: John Dowie: sculptor
results.creator_credit: Graham Bye, Alcoa Australia and Film Partnership (Vic.)
results.brief_description: Narrated by the sculptor, the film shows a number of works by John Dowie. The Adelaide-born sculptor uses plaster, stone, bronze and aluminium as mediums for his works. Various sculptures around Adelaide are featured; the wall reliefs in the Library of the South Australian Institute of Technology and the fountain at Victoria Square amongst them.

results.title: John Canemaker: marching to a different toon [DVD]
results.brief_description: John Canemaker is a well-regarded American animator who works in a variety of styles and has always succeeded in plumbing an array of emotions and situations in a humorous and engaging manner. Canemaker is also an esteemed animation historian and biographer. His fluid style, hand drawn and quite low-tech, is unpredictable and highly entertaining, cleverly evolving from one moment to the next. “Confessions of a star dreamer”: An actress and vamp discusses her feelings toward procreating, her craft and the industry. “Bridgehampton”: With music by Fred Hersch, this piece elegantly portrays a suburban changing of the seasons. “Confessions of a stand-up”: Wonderful piece satirising the pitfalls and pratfalls of being a comedian, as told by Dennis Blair. “Bottom’s dream”: Canemaker reworks the notions underpinning Shakespearean comical character, Bottom. “The Wizard’s son”: The young son of a wizard imagines the possibilities and adventures that await him, wreaking havoc in the meantime. “Behind the scenes”: An absurd piece on the interaction between line, form and shape. Bonus material includes excerpts from: “The Creative spirit” with a commentary about creative thought and processes; “Laughter is good medicine”; “Break the silence: kids against child abuse”; “What do children think when they think of the bomb”; “Science experiences”; and three thirty second advertisements for AIDS benefits.

results.title: John Brown, Rose and the Midnight Cat (K)
results.brief_description: Illustrations by Ron Brooks from the book of the same name by Australian writer Jenny Wagner are used to tell the story of Rose, an old widow, and John Brown, her trusty sheep dog, who live together comfortably until a midnight cat strays into their garden and challenges John Brown for Rose’s affections. Adaptation by Ernest Troost. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: John Arden: playwright
results.creator_credit: John irvin, David Naden, David Naden and Associates and Mithras Films
results.brief_description: A study of the modern British playwright, John Arden, by a group of young filmmakers. They have attempted “to make the business of being a playwright seem less remote, more immediate and understandable”. reveals the effect of his wife’s criticism upon his writing. Filmed at his home in Yorkshire.

results.title: Johanna
results.creator_credit: Wim Umboh, J. Adisubrata and Gramedia Film
results.brief_description: A young Lydia Kandou plays Johanna, a Dutchman’s daughter living during the Dutch occupation of Indonesia. Johanna is kidnapped by Pengkuh, a local rebel whose girlfriend is killed by a Dutch soldier, and taken to the jungle. What develops between the Dutch girl and Pengkuh is a ‘Blue Lagoon’ type inter-racial romance set against the lush, green backdrop of the Javanese forest. The film features rare explicit on-screen kisses, which would otherwise only be seen in the genre of cheap ‘sex-themed’ Indonesian films. Cast includes Lydia Kandou and Atek Sudharmo. In Indonesian with English subtitles.

results.title: Joh's jury
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Rod Allan, ABC-TV (Australia) and Southern Star Sullivan Productions
results.brief_description: From the team who created the award-winning ‘Police State’ and ‘Police Crop’ comes the gripping story of the jury deliberations which followed the 1991 trial of former Queensland Premier, Sir Joh Bjelke-Petersen. On trial for perjury, Sir Joh, the man responsible for shaping the cultural ethos of Australia’s ‘Deep North’, would now be judged by his peers. Based on extensive research, ‘Joh’s Jury’ is about twelve ordinary people struggling to come to a unamimous decision on a case which was bound to end in controversy. It is a dramatic interpretation of real events using Court transcripts and interviews with key participants in the trial of Sir Joh Bjelke-Petersen, including members of the jury. Stars Gerry Connolly as Sir Joh Bjelke-Petersen, Penny Cook, Noah Taylor, John Jarratt Norman Yemm and John Clayton.

results.title: Joey: the autobiography of Joey Deacon (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Brian Gibson, Peter Goodchild and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Joey Deacon, born in 1920 with brain damage, grew up severely spastic, unable to talk or walk. When, in 1928, his mother died, he was sent to an institution where he lived for years, quite unable to make himself understood. Then, in 1941, he met Ernie Roberts who had one remarkable skill - he could understand Joey. This led to a new and richer life, and this film tells Joey’s remarkable story. Based on Joey Deacon’s book “Tongue tied”.

results.title: Joey
results.creator_credit: Graham Parker, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: He was a likable seven-year-old boy, but he had been abandoned by his parents. He was first placed in a foster home; later, new parents were found for him. Joey is a story of adoption as seen from the child’s point of view. Made with the cooperation of the Children’s Aid Society, the film shows the measure of success that adoption authorities are experiencing today in placing older children.

results.title: Joe Leahy's Neighbours
results.brief_description: Joe Leahy’s Neighbours is a film of truly compelling interest, one of the greatest documentaries made in Australia in recent years. Fashioned from the material shot by Bob Connolly and Robin Anderson during an extended stay in the Papua New Guinea highlands, it presents a portrait of a society only slowly adjusting to the demands of a modern world - a society caught between ancient tribal loyalties and the sharp business practices of the twentieth century. Rated: G
